meanings.definition: To make something literal or concrete.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to literalize the abstract concept into a tangible object.
meanings.sent2: He always literalizes metaphors instead of appreciating their deeper meaning.
meanings.sent3: I tried to literalize the joke, but it just ended up sounding silly.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was so vivid that she could literalize any idea into reality.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to literalize emotions through his paintings.

meanings.definition: To interpret something in a literal or factual manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to literalize every statement, missing out on the underlying message.
meanings.sent2: It is important to not always literalize every piece of literature.
meanings.sent3: She would always literalize jokes, taking away their humor.
meanings.sent4: His mind was so analytical that he would literalize even the most poetic lines.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's job is to literalize data and draw accurate conclusions.
